RECORD:
Rare disease patients have complex clinical representations. Patients with Epilepsy, Progressive Myoclonic 1b present clinical features that include epilepsy, progressive myoclonus, and dementia.

The Epilepsy, Progressive Myoclonic 1b is caused by mutations in the EPM1B gene. The EPM1B gene provides instructions for making a protein called dynamin-1B. Dynamin-1B is involved in the. Some special cases also present with myoclonus.

The main symptomatic differences of Epilepsy, Progressive Myoclonic 1b from similar diseases is that Epilepsy, Progressive Myoclonic 1b patients have progressive myoclonus, progressive dementia, and progressive epilepsy.
